message: I'm excited to offer you this amazing product for a one-time price of $18000. It's a unique opportunity to acquire a valuable asset that will bring you long-term benefits.
I'm interested in the product, but I think $18000 is a bit steep. I'm willing to meet you halfway and offer $14000 for the product. I'm confident that we can come to a mutually beneficial agreement.

I appreciate your willingness to meet me halfway, Bob, but I'm afraid $14000 is still a bit low for me. I'm willing to compromise, so I'll counteroffer at $16000. I think this is a fair price considering the value the product will bring to you.

I understand that you're willing to compromise, Alice, but $16000 is still a bit above my budget. I'm willing to meet you at $15500. I think this is a fair price considering the value I'll get from the product. Can you consider this offer?

I appreciate your persistence, Bob, but I'm still not convinced that $15500 is enough for me to let go of the product. I'm willing to meet you at $16200, which is the lowest I'm willing to go. I believe this price reflects the product's value and is a fair compromise.
I understand that you're willing to meet me at $16200, but I'm still a bit short on budget. I'm willing to go up to $15800, but that's as high as I can go. Can you consider this offer?
